result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 4th Offense and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 4th Offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Norman G Conrad was found guilty of OWI 4th Offense, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(8:23 AM case called.) Defendant Norman G Conrad in court. Attorney David Czech in court for Norman G Conrad. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: OWI 4th Offense. Prior offenses acknowledged.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation and Attorney Czech outlines the defendant's medical conditions.

Court orders sentence withheld and places the defendant on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:
$600.00 fine/forfeiture. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 12 months jail with Huber privileges or Electronic Monitoring if the jail determines eligible with the last 6 months stayed pending further order of the Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations. 30 month driver's license revocation. 36 month ignition interlock device. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include the Sacred Heart Hospital blood draw fee. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Same as Complaint.
